Remove any redundant spills of this value in SLI.reg and sibling copies.

foldMemoryOperand - Try folding stack slot references in Ops into their instructions.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Ops">Operand indices from <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9497f45131416e6d7d716221c3deee8c">AnalyzeVirtRegInBundle()</a>.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="LoadMI">Load instruction to use instead of stack slot when non-null.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True on success.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/inlinespiller-cpp/#l00214">214</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/inlinespiller-cpp">InlineSpiller.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### hoistSpillInsideBB() {#ac8e52cad48ef33aa3ad8dc031b815f25}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool InlineSpiller::hoistSpillInsideBB (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a> &amp; SpillLI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; CopyMI)</>}>
It is beneficial to spill to earlier place in the same BB in case as follows: There is an alternative def earlier in the same MBB.

Hoist the spill as far as possible in SpillMBB. This can ease register pressure:

x = def y = use x s = copy x

Hoisting the spill of s to immediately after the def removes the interference between x and y:

x = def spill x y = use killed x

This hoist only helps when the copy kills its source.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/inlinespiller-cpp/#l00205">205</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/inlinespiller-cpp">InlineSpiller.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/inlinespiller-cpp/#l00216">216</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/inlinespiller-cpp">InlineSpiller.cpp</a>.
